needs.description: Over 3,000 people displaced in January 2026 due to intensified armed clashes between ELN and dissident FARC groups, with 1,200 seeking shelter in temporary sites in Arauca city.
Health facilities in Arauca department report 45% reduction in essential medicines, with malaria cases rising to 1,200 in January 2026, a 30% increase from December 2025.
UN OCHA reports 120 incidents of threats against human rights defenders in Arauca in 2025, with 15 killings recorded, creating a climate of fear among local populations.

needs.description: IPC analysis shows 65% of Tumaco's rural population in IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) or higher due to armed group restrictions on fishing and agriculture, affecting approximately 45,000 people.
UNICEF reports 60% of water systems in rural Tumaco damaged by armed conflict, leaving 25,000 people without reliable access to safe drinking water.
WHO data shows a 40% increase in acute malnutrition cases among children under 5 in Tumaco municipality, with 1,200 cases recorded in January 2026.

needs.description: UNHCR reports 420,000 Venezuelan refugees and migrants in Norte de Santander department as of February 2026, with 85,000 in Cúcuta city living in overcrowded conditions or informal settlements.
IOM data indicates 12,000 people in Cúcuta lack adequate shelter, with 3,500 in emergency shelters operating beyond capacity due to recent influx from Venezuela.
Protection monitoring shows 2,100 cases of SGBV reported in Cúcuta in 2025, with only 30% receiving adequate support services due to funding constraints.

needs.description: OCHA reports 8,500 people displaced in Buenaventura in January 2026 due to gang violence, with 3,200 seeking refuge in collective centers lacking basic services.
WHO reports 25% of health facilities in Buenaventura non-functional due to infrastructure damage and supply shortages, affecting 180,000 residents' access to care.
UNICEF data shows 40% of the population in Buenaventura lacks access to safely managed sanitation, contributing to cholera outbreak with 180 confirmed cases in January 2026.

needs.description: IPC analysis indicates 55% of Choco department's population, including Quibdó, in IPC Phase 3 or higher, with 78,000 people facing crisis-level food insecurity due to armed conflict and flooding.
WHO reports malaria incidence in Quibdó at 3,800 cases per 1,000 population in 2025, the highest in Colombia, with limited access to preventive measures in rural areas.
UNICEF data shows 45 schools in Quibdó municipality closed due to armed group presence, affecting 12,000 students' access to education in 2025.

needs.description: IOM reports 5,200 people displaced to Meta department in January 2026, with 2,800 arriving in Villavicencio city, primarily from rural conflict zones in Guaviare and Caquetá.

FEWS NET analysis shows Meta department facing Stressed (IPC Phase 2) conditions, with 15,000 people in Villavicencio area at risk of deteriorating to Crisis without sustained humanitarian assistance.
Health authorities report 1,200 cases of dengue fever in Villavicencio in January 2026, a 25% increase from the same period in 2025, straining local health services.

WFP data indicates 20% of rural households in Nariño face food consumption gaps, with 35,000 people in Pasto area experiencing Stressed (IPC Phase 2) conditions.
